teaser.title: GAIA-X4FutureMobility Cluster: Project moveID
teaser.text: Deployment of decentralized mobility data spaces and self-sovereign identity technologies in smart vehicles and traffic solutions.

paragraphs.title: Use cases
paragraphs.body:
- **Intelligent mobility infrastructure management**: V2X / digital upgrading of vehicle/infrastructure components
- **Zoning**: setting up and enforcing spatial access restrictions, e.g. urban environmental zones
- **Smart Parking**: Search & pay-as-you-go of parking/charging infrastructure - across providers
- **Vehicle Data Collection**: Vehicle as a data hub for detecting road conditions and vehicle component status
- **Non-discriminatory access** to digital services in a closely networked European infrastructure
- **Preservation of autonomy** with regard to private data and improvement of security and trustworthiness in a future Internet of Things
- Achieving or restoring a **fair market economy** in the area of digital data business models

paragraphs.title: About
paragraphs.body:
We are part of the [Gaia-X 4 Future Mobility](https://www.gaia-x4futuremobility.dlr.de) project family consisting of five consortia. The Gaix-X 4 Future Mobility project family is located in the mobility domain of the [German Gaia-X Hub](https://www.data-infrastructure.eu/GAIAX/Navigation/EN/Home/home.html). The common focus of the projects in the family is on the [Gaia-X](https://gaia-x.eu)-based implementation of future mobility applications with high product proximity, for which data-based networking with manufacturers, suppliers, service providers, and users is essential.

Accordingly, a wide variety of partners from all application, research, and topic areas of mobility and, in particular, information and communication technologies are involved here.

In total, around 80 partners from industry and science are involved in this joint initiative that is coordinated by the [DLR Institute for AI Safety and Security](https://www.dlr.de/ki/en/desktopdefault.aspx/tabid-17270/27361_read-69839).
